definition: lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
horsebit/variant of 鏢|镖[biao1]

sentences.english: From this place the party again diverged , according to their several fancies.
sentences.chinese: 这伙人根据各自的爱好，又从这里分道扬镳。

sentences.english: citing irreconcilable differences, one party will jilt the other sooner rather than later.
sentences.chinese: 无法调解的分歧很快就会使两党分道扬镳。

sentences.english: We parted wishing each other well.
sentences.chinese: 我们双方只能在互道祝福后分道扬镳。

sentences.english: Later in the evolution of whale hearing, the toothed and baleen whales parted ways.
sentences.chinese: 鲸豚听觉的演化到了后期，齿鲸与须鲸就分道扬镳了。

sentences.english: Horrified , Mr Chanes de Armas first punched him, then drifted away.
sentences.chinese: 震惊之余，阿马斯第一次开始抨击他，然后分道扬镳。

sentences.english: Dodonna and Tallon parted ways, with both going into hiding.
sentences.chinese: 多登纳和塔隆分道扬镳，都转入地下。

sentences.english: In a negatively curved, saddle-shaped universe, parallel beams would diverge.
sentences.chinese: 如果宇宙呈马鞍形反向弯曲，平行光线就会分道扬镳。

sentences.english: Finally, we went our separate ways.
I guess the only thing to do now is call a halt to this negotiation and part, friend.
sentences.chinese: 我想如今专一能做的便是制止会商，然后分道扬镳吧。

sentences.english: The two sides agreed not to criticize each other and went separate ways.
sentences.chinese: 双方达成一致，绝不相互指责，继而分道扬镳。

sentences.english: But then our visions of the future began to diverge and eventually we had a falling-out.
sentences.chinese: 可是我们对未来的愿景不同，最后只好分道扬镳。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen and Chen Jiongming soon split over the continuation of the Northern Expedition.
sentences.chinese: 孙逸仙和陈炯明不久就因继续北伐的事宜而分道扬镳。

sentences.english: Its open approach will be what sets the company apart from Microsoft.
sentences.chinese: 其开放的解决方案令其与微软分道扬镳。

sentences.english: We may as well exchange good-by and go separate ways.
sentences.chinese: 我们还是互道再见，分道扬镳吧。

sentences.english: Then they go their separate ways.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们就分道扬镳了。

definition: to be estranged
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to disband/(of a partnership, group etc) to break up
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
(literary) stranger
to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
incompatibility of temperament
to part company/to split up/to break up
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
